1.description: Evan's birthday party.  From left to right: Milo, Andreas, Felix, Sylvie, Mila, Evan Fraser and Evan Cappel.

2.description: We went to the Hawaiian island of Kauai and noone was injured by the coconuts.

anini1.description: We stayed on Anini Beach, where all the other fashionable millionaires have their vacation homes.
anini1.title: Anini 1

anini2.description: Very key for those of us with tender alabaster skin was the huge tree on the beach.
anini2.title: Anini 2

anini3.description: Nana and Felix sandcastling under the tree.
anini3.title: Anini 3

anini4.description: Everything about the location was perfect;  even the sand was the perfect consistency for sand castles.
anini4.title: Anini 4

anini6.description: Like every good tree, this one has a rope swing.
anini6.title: Anini 6

anini7.description: Felix quickly figured out his favorite way to swing.
anini7.title: Anini 7

anini9.description:
We rented a kayak for the week and took daily excursions right from our front door. That's Dean and Felix on it now. There was even a river nearby that we could explore.

Notice that the water is very flat. Anini beach has a reef, which makes the surf break way far out (you can see it in this picture), leaving the inside bathtub-calm and full of fish. A perfect toddler and snorkeling beach.
anini9.title: Anini 9

beach1.description: Sunset didn't come in a blaze of orange and pink, but more subtle blues as the sun dropped behind the mountains.
beach1.title: Beach 1

beach3.description: Anini beach is so calm even Milo could get some saltwater action.
beach3.title: Beach 3

beach4.description: Nana pilots the inflatable Felix raft.
beach4.title: Beach 4

beach5.description: REAL white boys wear hats even in the shade.
beach5.title: Beach 5

beach7.description: Felix wasn't so keen on being in water.  In fact, he never got in above his knees.  Boats were more to his taste.
beach7.title: Beach 7

beach8.description: Milo's a real trouper:  he didn't seem to mind getting sandy and wet.
beach8.title: Beach 8

birds.description: Very pretty birds would often come visit.
birds.title: Birds

hanalei.description: Hanalei, a town a few miles from Anini beach, is in a gorgeous river valley.
hanalei.title: Hanalei

helicopter1.description: Dean took a helicopter tour of the island.
helicopter1.title: Helicopter 1

helicopter3.description: Much of Kauai is privately owned, has no roads, and doesn't allow hikers.  The only way to see a lot of its spectacular terrain is by aircraft.  There's a billion waterfalls.
helicopter3.title: Helicopter 3

helicopter4.description: We landed in a very small clearing for lunch.
helicopter4.title: Helicopter 4

helicopter5.description:
... and swam in a waterfall-fed lagoon that is accessible only by helicopter.

If you're a glutton for aerial photography, here are more pictures of Dean's helicopter trip.
helicopter5.title: Helicopter 5

mosquitos.description: The only downside to a Kauai vacation?  The skeeters.   They loved Felix's tender skin.   Here, Nana puts anti-itch stuff on the bites.
mosquitos.title: Mosquitos

na_pali1.description: Dean, Lucie and Milo hiked a bit of the Kalalau trail, along the fabled Na Pali coast.
na_pali1.title: Na Pali 1

na_pali2.description: As we started to head back on the trail, it began to rain, hard and warm.   Fortunately Milo loved it:  even as he was getting blasted by wind and water he was squealing happily and giggling.  Go Milo!
na_pali2.title: Na Pali 2

roosters.description: Wild roosters are everywhere on Kauai; apparently they outnumber humans.   They cock-a-doodle-doo all day and night.  Our first night, Felix kept waking up saying, "It's daytime!".
roosters.title: Roosters

snorkeling1.description: There was great snorkeling right in front of our house.  The fish loved the calm reef waters.
snorkeling1.title: Snorkeling 1

snorkeling2.description: Say hi to this Moorish Idol.  His name is Charlie.
snorkeling2.title: Snorkeling 2

standing.description: At the beginning of our vacation, Milo was shaky at pulling himself to standing.   After a week practicing on this coffee table, he hardly had to think about it.
standing.title: Standing

whales.description: Whale watching.  Felix was more interested in play-acting the whale breaches than the actual thing, but a good time was had by all.
whales.title: Whales

zend1.description: Nana, Dean and Felix have a sunset dinner in nearby Princeville.
zend1.title: Zend 1

zend2.description: Felix highly recommends their signature hot dog dish.
zend2.title: Zend 2

description:
We packed up our swimsuits and headed to Hawaii this week, renting a house with Nana on the island of Kauai. It was a fantastic vacation.

Milo started babbling! Dean first noticed something that sounded like pre-babble on Wednesday (a lot of "wuh-wuh-wuh"). By Thursday it was definitely babble (ba-ba-buh-ba). By Saturday it was quite nuanced: happly little babbles when he woke up, serious babbles when he wanted to crawl to something, and plaintive babbles when hungry or tired or just pissed off, like when strapped in the car seat.
title: February 13
